name: Hilton Woodland Hills

reviews.text: We stayed on the Executive Floor which provided access to the Lounge. What a warm reception we received from the Concierge (Rosie) there! And we noticed that all who came into the Lounge were greeted with Rosie's wonderful smile and desire to make sure everyone was comfortable and well-served. My husband and I have stayed on the Executive Floor at different Hilton locations where the food always has been tasty and appealing. But we don't think that any can surpass the kind of hospitality we experienced with Rosie at the Woodland Hills.
reviews.title: Executive Floor Lounge Concierge

reviews.text: Great hotel with everything we needed for a restful 2-night stay. Staff accommodated nicely, and even upgraded our room! Nicely updated, sparkling clean and roomy. However, if you are in a corner room, beware the oddly placed coffee table (between the bed and the bathroom) on which if you are like me, you may knock your knee during the night. Access to rooftop tennis courts. We were tired after long days at work, but walked to adjacent Cheesecake Factory to pick up a take-out order and shockingly were back in only 10 minutes! Starbucks also walkable....across the street. Parking charges of $14 weekday and $9 for weekend were a turnoff, but didn't have to worry about safety. Near 101, but if you are traveling north the highway access is less accessible. Did not use the pool/spa.
reviews.title: Relax, you're home!

reviews.text: After 8 years of coming to this hotel it is time to say goodbye. I will definitely comeback on vacation as the staff here is amazing along with the location. First I want to thank Babette for being accessible and listening to the frequent guest for suggestions and make changes in the concierge lounge for the better of the guest both for breakfast and evening reception. I also want to recognize Rosie for making the guest feel welcome and always going beyond her duties to ensure we guests have a great experience. I also want to thank Ann, Eduardo and the rest of the front desk crew for their excellent service and always making me feel a valued customer. I also would like to thank the valet parking crew Danny, Mark & Maurice for always remembering me and using my name at checking or any time I would call in the car or get the car. This hotel has a great location and a great staff that
reviews.title: Bitter Sweet!

reviews.text: makes it a must to stay at.
reviews.title: Restruant experience....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful meal in your hotel restaurant, it was beautifully presented when served, and very tasty.
reviews.title: Mostly for business but good location

reviews.text: I've stayed in this location several weeks in the past few months. Every front-of-house staff member I enteract with are each gracious, kind, caring, and make it an enjoayable place to spend time while on the road in this area. Rosie in the executive lounge area makes every evening much more enjoyable with care and attention she gives to her guests like me. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Friendly staff make this a wonderful place to stay.
Beautiful View
reviews.text: The locations was okay. The service was great. The Breakfast was good with various options. There was plenty of room, linens for bed were very clean. Yeah.....Room was quiet and cool. I would recommend this to family and friends.

Staff were courteous, kind, helpful. Room was clean and spacious. Bed was very comfortable. Parking was close by. Food was a bit pricy, but was of good quality and the service was excellent. Business meeting area was very nice, chairs were comfortable, food was good, ventilation was good.
reviews.title: Great Place to stay

reviews.text: This hotel charges you separately and expensively for every convenience and amenity most hotels include in their nightly rate. Apart from comfortable beddings, there really is nothing special about this chain. Stay at the Bestwestern instead. They're honest with their charges.
reviews.title: Avoid this hotel - stay at the Best Western instead.

reviews.text: Beyond excellence of service & hospitality!!!!!
reviews.title: Weekend Seminar & Banquets Services

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We mostly join Hilton Hotels, love their comfort. We like to stay in business-hotels, because they are luxery and mostly quiet.The Woodland Hills was our second hotel on our California-Trip this year. Looking back, it was average...the rooms were Hilton-like good - very good. The service was good, but we missed hospitility. The rate for the hotel was too expensive for that we found ...the lounge was closed and parking was also expensive.
reviews.title: There are better Hiltons in LA

reviews.text: Outside it was a litte bit boring - a boring shopping-center some footsteps away.
reviews.title: GOLDEN DIAMOND SERVICE WITH A SMILE

reviews.text: I think it is no hotel for a longer stay or for tourists. One night was ok.
reviews.title: More Than Expected

reviews.text: I am not a fan of business travel and hotel stays, my general experience is mediocre at best. During my latest travel stays, I have been staying at the Hilton Hotel in Woodland Hills. This is by far the best of experiences. The hospitality at both the front desk and concierge lounge are excellent. On a special note, I would like to recognize Rosie at the concierge lounge. She is extremely helpful, courteous and always greets me with a welcoming smile. She is simply fantastic and goes out of her way to make me feel at home! I would also like to recognize Kalahari at the breakfast restaurant, she too is great. I really enjoy staying at this hotel and look forward to meeting them again at my next opportunity.
reviews.title: Rosie - Concierge

reviews.text: The room was spotless, the TV was a nice ~30 inch flat screen with plenty of channels, and the staff was courteous. Luckily I got a great deal through an online site and paid what I would have for a Motel 6. The property was located conveniently next to a shopping mall and numerous choices for dining. My family stayed for a night on the way to Hearst Castle and we were pleasantly surprised.
reviews.title: Good value weekend shopping and sight seeing

reviews.text: This hotel was very good. The staff was very accommodating and friendly The rooms were spacious and clean. The location is right next close to the freeway. There was two things that were negative about the hotel experience. First, the parking was not free. Second the parking structure is far from the main entrance of the hotel. Overall though the hotel was great. If I had the opportunity to stay at this hotel again I would definitely do so.
reviews.title: Overall a Great stay

reviews.text: Just spent 4 nights at the Hilton, Woodland Hills, attending my son's graduation from California State University, Northridge.
reviews.title: Excellent Service
Needs updating
reviews.text: Pros:
- great location: close to Northridge. convenient access to many restaurants and the 101 freeway.
reviews.title: Always Like Hilton Hotels

reviews.text: - excellent service: every employee we interacted with provided incredible service. From checking in, eating in the Executive lounge, dining in the restaurant and valet parking...everyone was polite, friendly and smiling.
reviews.title: Evening Diamond / Executive Lounge Service is excellent

description: A full-service hotel located within Warner Center in Woodland Hills. The Hilton Woodland Hills hotel offers modern amenities in the warm, Southern-California climate and is located near Los Angeles attractions including Universal Studios, The Getty Center, Malibu Beach and Hollywood. Our 326 guestrooms are the largest in the area and include wireless internet access, 37” LCD HDTV’s, and Hilton’s Serenity bedding collection. The hotel is walking distance to many fine restaurants, premier shopping and entertainment.
